A.title: Multiple Choice Questions (MCQs)
A.instructions:
(i) This section contains of 40 part questions and all are to be answered. Each question carries one mark.
(ii) This section 'A' of Multiple Choice Questions (MCQs) must be solved on the provided OMR sheet.
(iii) The correct answer bubble must be filled on OMR sheet.
(iv) Use only blue/black ball point pen on OMR sheet.
(v) Avoid pencil / White-o pen / correction pen / ink remover and gel pen to solve the questions on OMR sheet.

B.title: Short Answer Questions
B.instructions: Attempt Ten part-questions from this section, selecting at least Two part questions from each sub-section. All questions carry equal marks.

questions.question: Why does Bertrand Russell pin hope in the East to bring peace, progress and prosperity' in the world?
How did the panic end in 'The Day the Dam Broke'?
What is genuine freedom according to Liaquat Ali Khan?
What system is criticized in the play, 'Act Ill of the Silver Box'? State why.

subsections.name: SUB-SECTION II (Selections From English Verse Part-II)

questions.question: What does Thomas Campion's Upright Man think about worldly life?
Explain the title of the poem 'Say Not the Struggle Naught Avalieth.'
Describe the last stage of man's life as given in the poem 'The Seven Ages of Man'.
How did Ulysses inspire his sailors to embark on a new journey?
Who was Michael and how did he die?
Why did Lady Mauban extend support to Rudolf Rassendyll?
What is a ball? State its importance in the novel.
Who was the prisoner of Zenda? Why was he imprisoned?

C.title: Detailed Answer Questions
C.instructions: Attempt any TWO questions from this section. All questions carry equal marks.

questions.question: Write an essay on any One of the following topics:
topics: Need of Digital Literacy in Pakistan
Uses and Abuses of Smart Phone
Impacts of Corona on the World Economy

questions.question: Change the narration:
sentences: The leader said, 'Let's work together for the greater good of the country.'
She said, 'Oh! I lost my laptop.'
The chief guest said, 'It is a matter of great pleasure for me to be here with you today.'
The teacher said, 'The face is the index of the mind.'
The mother said, 'Where were you yesterday, Zahid?'

questions.question: Read the following passage and answer the questions given below:
questions.passage: 'I wanted to the anyway. I'd nothing to live for. The pain was pretty bad. I guess I fainted. When I came to, there was a Korean girl bending over me. She was about fourteen; not pretty, of course; but friendly brown eye, and long black plaits hanging in front of her shoulders. She didn't say anything. She just smiled. And I smiled back. Some busy-bodies chased her away. Then the ambulance came up and I was jolted for miles to a hospital. The pain was much worse. But I could bear it now. I didn't want to die any more. I wanted to live. I knew I should live. I had a purpose.'
questions: Identify the title of the text and the writer.
Who wanted to die and why?
Why did the speaker want to live after meeting the Korean girl?
